Updated: The TomorrowToday Experience Directory: A new interactive resource
for students and parents!
TomorrowToday is a digital companion to the weekly Student Opportunities Bulletin
empowers students to more easily explore, find, and engage with the many diverse
opportunities that are available in a more interactive way.
How Should Students Use It?
Students can access the directory via our weekly digital bulletin or at the link here.
Simply browse through the curated listings, find experiences that interest you, and
take the next steps to participate on the provider's website. The user-friendly interface
makes it easy to filter and search for specific opportunities.

Directory. Dive in, explore, and discover your career

This weekly bulletin informs students, parents, and staff about internships, academic
programs, jobs, leadership & community service initiatives, and other student
opportunities in a variety of fields. Please carefully note deadlines, age requirements,
and other pre-requisites for participation.
For ease of use, these newsletters are organized by different categories, such as
Academic Programs, Business Internships & Jobs, STEM Opportunities, Community
Service, and so on.
These various opportunities utilize different formats. Some are in-person, some
remote, and some will involve a hybrid arrangement. Check each program for their
specific format and schedule. Students should consider applying to any that match
their interests and talents.
Please note that in order to save space, many sections contain links to general lists of
related opportunities- such as for Stem programs, Community Service, College Prep
free programs, and more - be sure to click on any links that interest you.
Here are several programs of note in this week‚Äôs bulletin from various sections; some
have rapidly-approaching deadlines:
ACADEMICS: The 2025-2026 school year Columbia Science Honors program,
which offers Saturday STEM enrichment instruction, is now accepting applications
from current 9th, 10th, and 11th grade students ‚Äì financial aid is available for eligible
students. And the Yale Ethics Society High School Fellowship program welcomes
all interested students to their two-session virtual spring program on Ethics &
Philosophy
EVENTS: There is an after-school Postsecondary Programs Fair in Brooklyn
scheduled for 3/12, with 60+ post-high school options participating, including colleges
(including CUNY & SUNY schools), career, and other post-high school options
participating- current juniors especially are encouraged to attend.
All students may attend the in-person Community Board 14 Youth Programs
Summer Fair in Brooklyn after school on March 12th ‚Äì the focus is on programs for
that borough, but many citywide options will be represented as well.
BUSINESS: The generous Atlas Scholarship/Paid Summer Internship program for
under-resourced and/or under-represented students interested in business majors &
careers is accepting applicatiuons until March 3rd. And the Museum of Finance
Academy offers a free virtual five-session program in personal finance to current
juniors & seniors ‚Äì several of the top participatint students may receive $500 - $1,000
scholarships.
LEADERSHIP/GOVERNMENT/LAW:
Paid summer internships with the Office of the Mayor are available to students 16
and older ‚Äì the application deadline is March 30th. Several City Council candidates
have opened applications for their spring political campaigns.
And a batch of other excellent legal, social justice, and leadership opportunities have
fast-approaching early March deadlines.
MUSEUMS/ART:
The paid Gilder Lehrman Summer History Internships are open to all students
interested in history. And there is a variety of spring and summer options available to
students from the Met, MOMA, the NY Historical Society, the Museum of Arts &
Design, and more!
PARKS : Brooklyn Bridge Park‚Äôs TIDES spring term program is open to all
students with an interest in nature and the environment ‚Äì the application deadline is
March 7th.
STEM : The Manhattan/Staten Island (for all Stuy students 17 and older) and the
Bronx (for those 17 and older who live in the Bronx) Summer Health Internship
Programs are six-week medical-focused opportunities ‚Äì the first application deadline
is March 14th.
THEATER/MUSIC/WRITING: The free Summer Arts Institute at Frank Sinatra
High School in Queens offers students of all grades a variety of arts and performance
programs ‚Äì the application & virtual audition deadline is March 2nd !
Questions, suggestions, and information about other opportunities are always
welcome and appreciated, and may be sent to Internship/Opportunity Coordinator
Harvey Blumm at: hblumm@stuy.edu - we will share your helpful information with
the Stuy community!
